p: The proportion of palmitic acid (16:0) was higher in subsp. sinensis than subsp. rhamnoides. On the contrary, stearic acid (18:0) has a major proportion in subesp rhamnoides [ 1]. The proportion of palmitic acid is quite high in seed oil −15 to 20%– while in the case of stearic acid is very poor 2–4% [ 4].
